Hi I have a question on the uob one debit Mastercard. I used to perform transactions on Monday with credit card transactions to charity donation portal. The Uob one debit card did show the transaction posted successfully on Tuesday. But till then  I have not see it count against the $500 spending requirement in the account interest tracker. For sure  it will not get interest but I just want to count in the $500 spending requirement. There is nothing in T&C saying it will be excluded except for interest counting.
Donations not counted as eligible spend
Understood. Thanks. I tot it is only excluded for interest computation
Easiest way to meet quota for eligible spend is to buy physical NTUC vouchers from the aunty.
Hi can i ask for government and insurance will be excluded as well? Ex: road tax
Of course these are not eligible spend
But u buying every month to hit $500? I am trying to see how to hit the min spending as well
Of coz not. I can hit the Min soend so I don‚Äôt need to buy vouchers every month.Don‚Äôt get a min spend card if u can‚Äôt easily meet the Min though
Insurance is ok  not included for CC cashback

Yap. I thinking of that too. Groceries  utilities and teleco bills I computed can almost reached the $500 requirement. But to be sure  I will use my insurance to cover the ‚Äúlast mile. thanks for the advice

I am using my card to consolidate the household expense (telco  utilities  dining) except grocery shopping which I use Trust card. Plus a bit from insurance expense and I was able to hit the $500 requirement. The good thing is these household expense will also generate bonus interest for you.

It is what it says on the box.Aside  there are many considerations  how much you spend monthly  whether you prefer cashback or miles... etc. Typically  if you only use one card  the cashback/mpd might not be so high
I prefer cashback. I spend 1K a month
DBS WWMC  not sure if digital subscription included.
Citi smrt  citi rewards  uob ppv

Hi all  is it advisable to get into any investment plans with an FA? If not  what other solutions are there that is simple and straight forward for normal folks? My sibling is being sold a plan and idk how to convince otherwise because my personal method is investing in US market which is not the most convenient.
Not a FA  but pls don't get them. I suggest taking a look at endowus very straightforward and easy user interface. U can use CPF  SRS and cash.
Invest in US market is also quite painless and cheap with endowus  just search lion global fund (spy500) or similar funds like amundi prime usa fund.
Why msian without a valid pass which is visitor pass will have the need to open a bank account in sg?
my aunt is no longer a PR  so she has to take back her cpf. but she doesnt want to take her money back to msia
I think can try go bank counter query and give such details
Local banks normally need a valid pass.. but if she Maybank account in Malaysia   maybe can check with Maybank in SG.
Maybank and OCBC allows as long you have Malaysian passport.UOB and DBS confirm cannot.
